wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor

Class PopupComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor.PopupComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener

    abstract class PopupComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  PopupComponent.EditorBoundsWatcher
      Class to track changes in position or size on the popup's editor.
      (package private) class  PopupComponent.MouseHandler
      The mouse handler will select automatically the choice under the mouse, and passes directly the focus to the popup under the mouse.

      void addChoices(java.util.Collection<?> choices, IChoicesParser parser)

      Finds -and selects- the best match to a given content, using the existing history and choices.

      If jumpRequired is true, or cannot move down on the focused list and the focused list is the history list, then move to the first visible element on the choices list.

      • getStringComparator

        public java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String> getStringComparator()
        Returns the string comparator
        it will be invalid (null or not string comparator) for rendered content.

      • selectBestMatch

        public ChoiceMatch selectBestMatch(java.lang.Object hint)
        Finds -and selects- the best match to a given content, using the existing history and choices.
        It always favor content belonging to the choices list, rather than to the history list.
        Parameters:
        hint - an object used to select the match. If the content is text-based (there is no Renderer defined), the hint is considered the start of the string, and the best match should start with the given hint). If the content is not text-based, only exact matches are returned, no matter the value of the parameter perfectMatch
        Returns:
        a non null match (but its content can be null)

      • getCompletion

        public java.lang.String getCompletion(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the text that could complete the given string
        The completion string is the larger string that matches all existing options starting with the given string.

      • setPopupFocused

        public void setPopupFocused(boolean set)
        Informs that the focus is on the popup: this affects how the selected elements are displayed

      • isPopupFocused

        public boolean isPopupFocused()
        Returns true if the focus is currently on the popup.

      • getHistory

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getHistory()

      • selectFirst

        public boolean selectFirst(boolean forceJump)
        Selects the first element in the focused list. If it is already on the first element, or forceJump is true, selects the first element on the history list.
        Returns true if there is indeed a change (or forceJump is true)

      • selectLast

        public boolean selectLast(boolean forceJump)
        Selects the last element in the focused list. If it is already on the last element, or forceJump is true, selects the last element on the choices list.
        Returns true if there is indeed a change (or forceJump is true)

      • selectUp

        public boolean selectUp(boolean jumpRequired)
        If jumpRequired is true, or cannot move up on the focused list and the focused list is the choices list, then move to the last element on the history list.
        Otherwise, it just returns false

      • selectDown

        public void selectDown(boolean jumpRequired)
        If jumpRequired is true, or cannot move down on the focused list and the focused list is the history list, then move to the first visible element on the choices list.
        Otherwise, it just returns false

      • selectDownPage

        public void selectDownPage()
        Moves down a page, or to the last element in the choices list, if needed.

      • selectUpPage

        public void selectUpPage()
        Moves up a page, or to the first element in the history list, if needed.
